_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
notes: SPY weekly double calendar: 585P + 615C, short Feb 20 / long Feb 27
rationale: Weekly income, neutral bias, profit from front-month theta decay

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Enter when IV is LOW to moderate â€” benefits from rising IV

entry_timing.preferred_time: 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM ET (afternoon, after morning volatility settles)

futures_expiry_awareness.monthly_opex: 3rd Friday â€” avoid entering double calendars that straddle monthly OpEx (pin risk + unusual gamma)
futures_expiry_awareness.quarterly_futures: March/June/Sept/Dec 3rd Friday â€” ES/NQ/RTY futures expiry causes extra volatility, widen strikes or skip
futures_expiry_awareness.weekly_options: SPX M/W/F expirations, SPY Friday expirations â€” align short leg to nearest weekly expiry
futures_expiry_awareness.vix_expiry: Usually Wednesday, 30 days before next monthly OpEx â€” avoid if VIX expiry within front-leg DTE
futures_expiry_awareness.roll_timing: Roll front leg day BEFORE expiry (Thursday for Friday expiry) to avoid assignment/exercise risk

strike_selection.put_side: 1 standard deviation below current price (or at strong support level)
strike_selection.call_side: 1 standard deviation above current price (or at strong resistance level)
strike_selection.width: Put and call strikes equidistant from current price for neutral delta

entry_conditions.notes: Double calendar: two calendar spreads (put side + call side) around current price. Weekly income strategy. Enter Wednesday afternoon for Friday-expiring front legs. Avoid weeks with FOMC, CPI/PPI, quarterly futures expiry (extra gamma). Use standard deviation or technical support/resistance for strike selection.

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Combined value of far-month options minus total debit (at either strike at near-month expiry)
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Theta differential â€” near-week options decay fastest in last 2-3 days
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: IV expansion â€” LONG VEGA position, profits if IV stays elevated or increases
pnl_drivers.tertiary_driver: Gamma scalping â€” as front leg approaches expiry, gamma accelerates. If price stays in range, this works for you.

greeks_profile.theta: positive â€” near-week decay faster than far-week on both sides
greeks_profile.vega: POSITIVE â€” long vega, profits if IV stays elevated or increases
greeks_profile.delta: near neutral â€” put and call calendars offset each other
greeks_profile.gamma: slightly positive â€” near-month gamma higher, but flips negative if price moves to one side

pnl_drivers.risk_events: Avoid: FOMC announcement days, CPI/PPI release, quarterly futures/options expiry (quad witching), earnings if underlying is single stock
pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: Stock stays between the two calendar strikes through front-leg expiry. Both near-term options expire worthless. Far-term options retain time value. Close far-term legs for profit, or sell new front-month legs to repeat.
